Class GameManager

java.lang.Object
GameManager
public class GameManager extends Object
This class manages the game logic and flow for the Komputer Kivi game. It handles player turns, dice rolls, game state, and interactions between players and the game board. The class is responsible for coordinating the game mechanics, including rolling dice, placing tokens, and calculating scores. It also manages the game history through the Historian class, allowing for game state saving and loading along with undoing moves.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameManager

      public GameManager(List<Player> players, KiviBoardPanel gameBoardPanel, CurrentTurnPanel currentTurnPanel, PlayerPanel playerPanel, MainGameFrame mainGameFrame)
      Constructor for the GameManager class. Initializes the game board, players, and other components.
      Parameters:
      mainGameFrame - The main game frame.
      players - A list of players.
      gameBoardPanel - The game board panel.
      currentTurnPanel - The current turn panel.
      playerPanel - The player panel.

  • Method Details

    • playTurn

      public void playTurn(int row, int col)
      This method is called when a player plays their turn.
      Parameters:
      row - The row of the game board.
      col - The column of the game board.

    • analyzeDice

      public void analyzeDice()
      This method analyzes the current dice roll and determines the legal moves available to the player. It updates the game board panel with the legal moves and handles the end of the turn if no legal moves are available.

    • rollDice

      public void rollDice(int diceMask, int keepMask)
      This method rolls the dice for the current player. It ensures that the new values are different from the current values and updates the game board panel with the new dice values. It also manages the roll count and enables the analyze button.
      Parameters:
      diceMask - The dice mask.
      keepMask - The keep mask.

    • getTurns

      public Turn[] getTurns()
      This method retrieves the current stack of turns from the historian. It is used to access the history of moves made during the game.
      Returns:
      An array of Turn objects representing the history of moves.

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public Player getCurrentPlayer()
      This method retrieves the current player from the list of players. It is used to access the player whose turn it is currently.
      Returns:
      The current player.

    • calculateScores

      public void calculateScores()
      This method calculates the scores for all players. It iterates through the list of players and calls the calculateScore method for each player. This is used to update the scores based on the current game state.

    • gameOver

      public void gameOver()
      This method is called when the game is over. It calculates the final scores, determines the winner, and displays a message. It also resets the game state and closes the main game frame.

    • getRollCount

      public int getRollCount()

    • getGameBoardPanel

      public KiviBoardPanel getGameBoardPanel()

    • saveGame

      public void saveGame(String filename)
      This method saves the current game state to a file. It writes the player information, including their character, bitboard, tokens, and evil status. The file is saved in CSV format for easy loading later.
      Parameters:
      filename -

    • loadGame

      public static boolean loadGame(String filePath)
      This method loads a saved game from a file. It reads the player information from the file and reconstructs the game state. The file should be in CSV format, matching the format used in the saveGame method.
      Parameters:
      filePath -
      Returns:

    • undoLastMove

      public void undoLastMove()
      This method undoes the last move made in the game. It retrieves the last turn from the historian and updates the game board and player states accordingly.

    • getPlayers

      public List<Player> getPlayers()

    • setCurrentPlayerIndex

      public void setCurrentPlayerIndex(int currentPlayerIndex)

    • setCurrentBoardState

      public void setCurrentBoardState(long board)
